experiment_info.name: adaptive_temporal_fidelity
experiment_info.description: Start CMA-ES with 20% timestep fidelity, increase to 40% when fitness variance drops
experiment_info.hypothesis: Early exploration can use lower fidelity (faster), high fidelity only needed for final convergence

reason_aborted: This experiment is a duplicate of experiments/adaptive_timestep_fraction which already tested variable timestep fidelity during CMA-ES and FAILED. Key finding: CMA-ES covariance adaptation requires consistent fitness landscape - switching fidelity mid-run disrupts learning and leads to WORSE results.

previous_results.conclusion: FAILED - Both worse score AND more time than fixed 40% baseline
